Knowledge.name: Violet has a scar on her wrist
Colonel wants to leave the manor
Violet is a member of a cult
Thomas Used to Be Good Friends With James
Thomas is Afraid of Losing His Father
Thomas is Being Blackmailed by Violet
Thomas Knows Violet is Running a Cult
Liz Used to be in a Relationship With James
Liz Got James His Job as a Stable Boy
Liz Thinks Something Suspicious Is Happening At the Manor
Liz Wants to Work for the Baroness

PlotPoint.knowledge: Violet has a scar on her wrist

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh, you hurt your wrist?
It's scarred all over.
LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Why are you looking at my wrists?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Just the one.
Oh, you hurt your wrist?
It's scarred all over.
LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh, that. It's just a scrape, nothing serious.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: It looks fresh.
LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You should know, I can be very clumsy sometimes.

Instantiation.speaker: Violet
Instantiation.name: Violet is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh, you hurt your wrist?
It's scarred all over.
LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh, that. I was bitten by a great tiger whilst on my African safari.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You've been to Africa?
LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Never. Although I've heard it's splendorous.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I see...
Oh, you hurt your wrist?
It's scarred all over.
LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh, that. I was bitten by a great tiger whilst on my African safari.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You've been to Africa?
LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Never. Although I've heard it's splendorous.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I see...

PlotPoint.knowledge: Violet is a member of a cult

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Violet is in a cult and is told in a hateful way
Violet is in a cult and is told in a loving way

Instantiation.speaker: Violet
Instantiation.name: Violet is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Violet is in a cult and is told in a neutral way
Violet is in a cult and is told in a likeable way

PlotPoint.knowledge: Thomas Knows Violet is Running a Cult

Instantiation.speaker: Thomas
Instantiation.name: Thomas is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Thomas mentions quickly and quietly that he knows Violet is running a cult at the manor.
Thomas pulls Player aside and looking nervously around confides in Player that he knows Violet is running a cult and that everyone in the manor is in danger.
Thomas pulls Player aside and expresses his concern for them, confiding in them that Violet is running a cult and that everyone at the manor is in danger.

Player decides to speak more with Thomas, who rolls his eyes and mumbles something about wishing that people weren't frolicking about while Violet played around with the dark arts as master of a cult.

Instantiation.speaker: Thomas
Instantiation.name: Thomas is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Player asks if Thomas is alright and he tiredly admits to thinking of ways to save Colonel from his fate.
Player asks what is on Thomas' mind and he admits to worrying constantly about his father and about ways to protect him.
Player notices Thomas is acting strangely and asks him if he is alright. He smiles tiredly and confesses that he is consumed by thinking of ways to protect Colonel.
Player talks more with Thomas, who insists Player leave him be so he can protect Colonel in peace.

Instantiation.speaker: Liz
Instantiation.name: Liz is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Player asks Liz if she has any info about the manor and she mentions passively that it seems like Thomas has been over protective of Colonel since his arrival.

Instantiation.speaker: James
Instantiation.name: James is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: James seems to space out, and begins to wonder aloud as to why Thomas seems to be protecting Colonel and acting squeemish when others go near Colonel.

Instantiation.speaker: Violet
Instantiation.name: Violet is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Player asks Violet what is on her mind and she shrugs, mentioning that she is wondering why Thomas is being so over protective of Colonel. After a moment, she just smiles.
Violet eyes Player over, and asks if Player has also noticed that Thomas seems over protective of Colonel.
Violet bats her eyes at Player, saying in a curious tone that she is just baffled by Thomas' over protective state around Colonel. She laughs the thought off.
Player asks Violet what is on her mind and she rolls her eyes, saying that Player is just as over bearing upon her as Thomas is over protective of Colonel.

Instantiation.speaker: Baroness
Instantiation.name: Baroness is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Baroness notes spacily to herself that Thomas has been acting lately as if he is trying to protect Colonel from something.
Baroness pulls Player aside and confides in them, saying that she has never seen Thomas act so protectively around Colonel. She suspects something is wrong.

Instantiation.speaker: Thomas
Instantiation.name: Thomas is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Player casually asks Thomas about his sex life, who shrugs and says simply that he hasn't had one.
Player casually asks Thomas about his sex life, who says that he hasn't had one with a self-pitying chuckle.
Player asks flirtatiously if Thomas has tussled in the hayloft, so to speak. Equally flirtatiously, Thomas admits to never having done so.

Instantiation.speaker: Violet
Instantiation.name: Violet is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Violet mentions with a knowing smile that Thomas is a virgin, and chuckles lightly.
Violet asks if Player wants to hear something amusing. She says that Thomas is a virgin and chuckles to herself about it, noting it as humorous.

PlotPoint.knowledge: Thomas Used to Be Good Friends With James

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Violet mentions that she could make life hard for Player. After all, James and her brother used to be very good friends...
Violet laughs jovially, mentioning that she is happy her and Player are such good friends, almost like Thomas and James used to be.

Instantiation.speaker: Violet
Instantiation.name: Violet is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Violet mentions in passing that Thomas and James used to be very good friends.
James grows angry with Player, saying that Player is making him just as angry as he was with Thomas before he broke off their friendship.
James confides in Player, saying that he is glad to have such a good friend again, like what he used to have in Thomas.

Instantiation.speaker: James
Instantiation.name: James is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: James mentions in passing that he and Thomas used to be best friends.
Colonel confides in Player, saying that he wishes Thomas and James were friends like they used to be. He seems to have complicated reasons for thinking this.

Instantiation.speaker: Colonel
Instantiation.name: Colonel is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Colonel mentions that once upon a time, James and Thomas were best friends.

Instantiation.speaker: Liz
Instantiation.name: Liz is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Liz mumbles to herself that James and Thomas used to be such good friends too....
Liz confides in Player that James used to be a lot more cheerful when he and Thomas were good friends.
Liz laughs, saying that Player is just as cheerful and cute as James was before he broke off his friendship with Thomas. But Player is still cuter, she adds in quickly.
Player asks about Thomas' relationship with James. Thomas mumbles hurriedly that they were once good friends, but that that has nothing to do with anything.
Player asks Thomas about his relationship with James, and Thomas confides in the Player, mentioning that they were once best friends and that he wished it were still so.

Instantiation.speaker: Thomas
Instantiation.name: Thomas is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Player asks Thomas about his relationship with James, and Thomas shrugs as he admits to them being good friends once upon a time.

Instantiation.speaker: Baroness
Instantiation.name: Baroness is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Baroness mentions in passing that she wonders where James and Thomas' excellent friendship went wrong.
Baroness compliments Player, noting how nice they are and that she was just as good a friend as James was to Thomas all those years ago...

PlotPoint.knowledge: Thomas is Afraid of Losing His Father

Instantiation.speaker: Thomas
Instantiation.name: Thomas is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Player asks Thomas if he's alright, and Thomas mentions that he's extremely worried about the safety of Colonel.
Thomas confides in Player, telling them that he has never been more worried for Colonel than he is now.
Thomas confides in Player quietly, explaining that he is worried for Colone's safety.

PlotPoint.knowledge: Thomas is Being Blackmailed by Violet

Instantiation.speaker: Thomas
Instantiation.name: Thomas is neutral to the player

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Player asks Thomas about his relationship with Violet, and Thomas mumbles something under his breath about how she is a terrible person for black mailing him.
Thomas pulls Player aside discretely, telling them in confidence that Violet has been blackmailing him and that he's nervous.
Thomas pulls Player aside discretely, confiding in them that Violet has been black mailing him.
Player asks Thomas about his relationship with Violet, and Thomas says that it isn't any of Player's business, and he turns away mumbling something about her black mailing him.

PlotPoint.knowledge: Liz Used to be in a Relationship With James

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Liz sighs, mumbling something about how she misses cuddling with James.
Liz smiles sweetly, saying that spending time with player reminds her of her time in a relationship with James.
Liz rolls her eyes, making a comment about how everything used to be better when she was dating James.
Player asks James about his past relationships out of curiosity, and he tells Player not to worry, because any relationship will be better than the one he had with Liz.
Player asks James about his love life, and he answers with an eye roll that it's no one's business that he used to date Liz, and he wished no one brought it up.
James mutters something under his breath about how he wonders how Liz has been doing since he left her.
Violet mutters under her breath, saying that everything is going as nicely as when James broke up with Liz for her. She giggles.

Player asks Violet how she is, to which she responds that she wishes to be left alone, and that player is being as annoying as Liz was when she was dumped by James. Violet laughs to herself about this.
Violet asks player if they want to hear a little gossip: James and Liz used to be together, and it's her fault they broke up! She laughs.

PlotPoint.knowledge: Liz Got James His Job as a Stable Boy

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Player asks about James, ans she angrily yells that she was the one who got James a job at the manor in the first place and that he shouldn't be so awful to her.
Liz says flirtatiously to player that she can take them places, get them rich. She did after all, get James his job at the manor, she jokes.
Liz confides in player, telling them that she is frustrated because she got James his job at the manor in the first place. She says sadly that he shouldn't treat her so badly.
Player asks James about Liz, and he says that she's alright, and that she was the one who got him his job at the manor.

Player asks how James feels about Liz. He shakes his head with some frustration, saying quickly that she had gotten him his job at the manor, and that he wishes Player didn't ask him so many questions.
Violet asks Player if they want to hear an interesting fact about James. She says that it was Liz who got him hired at the manor.
Player asks Violet about Liz, and Violet rolls her eyes, saying that the only good thing that girl ever did was get James hired at the manor.

Violet cuddles up to Player, and asks if they want to hear something interesting. She says that it was Liz who got James hired at the manor, and she finds it absolutely entertaining that he treats her like he does.
Player asks Colonel about Liz, who says plainly that she got James to work the stables, and that that was a terrible move on her part.
Player asks Colonel what's on his mind, and he says that he was just thinking about the time Liz came to him about hiring James at the manor. He couldn't believe he said yes to that.

PlotPoint.knowledge: Liz Thinks Something Suspicious Is Happening At the Manor

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Player asks Liz how she is but she says in frustration that she has better things to do than talk to player; there are strange things happening at the manor.
Liz flirtatiously asks Player if they like detective work. Because she does, and she's on the case to find out what strange things are happening at the manor.
Liz whispers in confidence to Player that she believes there are strange things happening at the manor.
Liz pulls Player aside and asserts that they should watch their step because strange things are happening at the manor.

PlotPoint.knowledge: Liz Wants to Work for the Baroness

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Liz tells player to leave her alone, mumbling under her breath that everything would be so much better if she worked for the baroness.
Player asks Liz how she is, and she mentions lovingly that she wishes to work for the baroness and have player come with her.
Liz cautiously informs player that her plan is to end up working for the baroness.
Liz mentioned boredly that she would prefer working in a grander manor, like the baroness'.
The Baroness mentions that the manor's serving girl has been awfully respectful toward her. She wonders if that girl doesn't want a job.
Baroness tells player in confidence that she thinks the serving girl is trying to get a job at her manor.
The Baroness asks the player lovingly if they think that the serving girl would fit in better at the baroness' manor.
Liz is irritated with player and says astutely that at least she isn't a virgin.
Liz leans in and whispers to player that she could teach them many things because, after all, she hasn't been a virgin for years.
Player asks Liz about her sex life and she laughs, claiming to have been around the bend several times.
Liz mentions casually that she hasn't had sex in months.
James strokes player's hair and mumbles lovingly that he is glad they aren't a slut like Liz was.
Player asks James about his relationship with Liz, and he mutters something about despite her having had sex several times, she never gave him any.
Violet is giggling about something. Player asks what it's about and she shakes her head, saying that she can't believe anyone would sleep with Liz.
Liz tells player to go away; all she cares about right now is getting James back.
Liz tells player that she wants nothing more than to win James back into her arms.
Liz confides in the player that she misses being in a relationship with James, and she wants him back.
